title: How to Block Adult Sites on Any Device

steps.title: Go to https://account.microsoft.com/family and sign in.
steps.content: Go to https://account.microsoft.com/family and sign in. You must be the family organizer to have the ability to manage other family members. You can also go to that site, log in, then click Add a family member and enter their email address. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Family Safety works for any Microsoft account, including accounts on Xbox, Windows computers/laptops, Edge browsers, and the mobile app on Android and iOS.

steps.title: Click the family member you want to manage.
steps.content: Click the family member you want to manage. Clicking their profile picture will redirect you to a page with more options.

steps.title: Click Edge.
steps.content: Click Edge . You'll see this tab at the top of the page between Windows and Mobile .

steps.title: Click the toggle next to "Filter inappropriate…" to turn it on.
steps.content: Click the toggle next to "Filter inappropriate…" to turn it on. This setting will enable SafeSearch in Bing so searches will not bring up inappropriate content or links to browsers other than Edge.

steps.title: Click the toggle next to "Only use allowed websites" (optional).
steps.content: Click the toggle next to "Only use allowed websites" (optional). If you want to block specific websites, you can switch this toggle. Click + next to "Allowed" or "Blocked" websites to add more. AI will trigger and allow educational websites through the filter.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . This gear icon is in the top left corner of the page and will open another window with more options.

steps.title: Set the age rating.
steps.content: Set the age rating. Use the drop-down box to pick an age; Microsoft will filter out inappropriate apps, games, and media depending on the age you pick.

steps.title: Toggle on web safety.
steps.content: Toggle on web safety. This will prevent other browsers from working on connected devices; meaning the managed user can only use Edge with Bing, and Bing will have SafeSearch enabled. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Download the Family Safety app for Android and iPhone to block adult sites on smartphones too. Open the app, tap Edge , and the follow the same steps as using the website.

steps.title: Open Screen Time.
steps.content: Open Screen Time. With Screen Time, you can block inappropriate content on your Apple device. For iPhone & iPad, go to Settings > Screen Time. For Mac, go to System Settings > Screen Time.

steps.title: Select the family member you want to manage.
steps.content: Select the family member you want to manage. If you don't have Family Sharing set up, you can only use this method to manage your own account.

steps.title: Click or tap Content & Privacy.
steps.content: Click or tap Content & Privacy . You might be asked to enter your passcode. If it's not already on, enable the toggle for "Content & Privacy."

steps.title: Select App Store, Media, Web, & Games.
steps.content: Select App Store, Media, Web, & Games . This will open those options.

steps.title: Select Web Content.
steps.content: Select Web Content . This opens more options.

steps.title: Select Limit Adult Websites.
steps.content: Select Limit Adult Websites . You can make this more strict by selecting "Allowed Websites" instead; only the websites that you enter will load for the managed user. Click Customize to add sites that you specifically want to block. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Family Link app.
steps.content: Open the Family Link app. If you aren't signed in, sign in now.

steps.title: Select the user you want to manage.
steps.content: Select the user you want to manage. If they aren't part of your family, you won't be able to manage their internet behavior. You can add them by tapping the three-line menu icon, then tapping Add child .

steps.title: Tap Content restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Content restrictions . If you don't see this, go to Controls .

steps.title: Tap Google Chrome and Web.
steps.content: Tap Google Chrome and Web . It's in the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Try to block explicit sites.
steps.content: Tap Try to block explicit sites . This setting will try to block adult sites. You can make this more strict by choosing "Only allow approved sites" and adding the approved sites below. You can also open the "Google Play Store" option to be able to set age limits for the content in apps, movies, books, and anything else available in the Google Play Store. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Turn Safe Search on.
steps.content: Turn Safe Search on. This setting filters out search results with adult content. You don't need to pay for Safe Search, so it's a good non-cost first step to filtering porn on your computer. You can use Safe Search even if you're not using the Google Chrome web browser. Instead, all that's needed is to use a Google account. However, this can also be easily bypassed. This setting is automatically enabled if the associated Google account is less than 18 years old. If you can't change this setting, it was mostly likely set by an adult account. Even schools and public spaces (like airports and libraries) can prevent you from turning SafeSearch off. [5] X Research source To turn on Safe Search, go to https://www.google.com/safesearch in your web browser and make sure the circle next to "Filter" is selected.

steps.title: Enable the strict setting of Bing's SafeSearch.
steps.content: Enable the strict setting of Bing's SafeSearch. This setting filters out adult text, images, and videos from search results. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You don't need to pay for SafeSearch, so it's a good non-cost first step to filtering porn on your computer. Navigate to Bing's SafeSearch settings . Click on the topmost radio button to enable strict filtering. Click Save at the bottom of the page to apply your changes.

steps.title: Use a professional pornography filter.
steps.content: Use a professional pornography filter. These can block unwanted websites and filter pornographic websites on not only your computer but connected mobile devices as well if offered. Popular programs include: Canopy Convent Eyes Net Nanny Covenant Eyes OurPact FamiSafe Norton Family Kidslox Bark Many of these programs have a subscription fee, but they also come with a free trial, so you can test the software to see if you like it before paying money. Katz recommends an app called Net Nanny to block porn from your phone.

steps.title: Many different extensions block porn.
steps.content: Many different extensions block porn. You can also use Chrome extensions like BlockSite to block porn sites. Note that extensions will only work if you use the same browser you installed them with. For example, if you install a porn blocker extension on Chrome, it won't work if you're using another browser like Brave.

steps.title: Many routers have parental controls pre-installed.
steps.content: Many routers have parental controls pre-installed. Blocking content at your router protects all connected devices—phones, tablets, and consoles—with parental controls. To block content from your router , you need to log into the router's admin website or use the mobile app provided by your ISP. Then find Parental Controls or similar wording and add blocks to content, results, and sites. Some routers, like those loaned out by bigger companies such as Spectrum and Comcast, come with mobile apps that you can use instead of going to the router's website.
